item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 9, 2025 at 5:10 AM UTC
item.description:
1. My 16-month theanine self-experiment (60 points | 32 comments)
2. Show HN: I built an app to get daily wisdom from Mr. Worldwide (158 points | 42 comments)
3. Presenterm: Markdown Slideshows in the Terminal (137 points | 25 comments)
4. AI tools are spotting errors in research papers (441 points | 160 comments)
5. Building an open-source Wi-Fi Mac layer for the ESP32 (24 points | 4 comments)
6. Roald Dahl on the death of his daughter (2015) (54 points | 6 comments)
7. GTA 6 fans gutted after learning it will be unplayable for PC Players at launch (5 points | 1 comment)
8. The DOJ still wants Google to sell off Chrome (257 points | 449 comments)
9. "Big 3" science fiction magazines including Asimov's and Analog acquired (91 points | 49 comments)
10. Ten Digit Problems (2011) [pdf] (14 points | discuss)
11. Deploy from local to production (self-hosted) (92 points | 45 comments)
12. Volkswagen reintroducing physical controls for vital functions (357 points | 240 comments)
13. Discovering errors in Donald Knuth's TAOCP (144 points | 43 comments)
14. How much traffic can a pre-rendered Next.js site handle? (14 points | 2 comments)
15. Discworld Rules (186 points | 232 comments)
16. Show HN: TypeLeap: LLM Powered Reactive Intent UI/UX (45 points | 19 comments)
17. MCP vs. API Explained (107 points | 64 comments)
18. Time for a Change: The long, contentious history of time shifts (25 points | 25 comments)
19. OneText (YC W23) is hiring a browser extension engineer ( | hide)
20. Long Read: Lessons from Building Semantic Search for GitHub and Why I Failed (109 points | 34 comments)
21. The program is the database is the interface (151 points | 47 comments)
22. Kill your Feeds – Stop letting algorithms dictate what you think (653 points | 246 comments)
23. Body Doubling (95 points | 69 comments)
24. Social Media Posts About Medical Tests with Potential for Overdiagnosis (23 points | 14 comments)
25. Spark-TTS: Text-2-Speech Model Single-Stream Decoupled Tokens [pdf] (57 points | 2 comments)
26. Ultrasonic deep drawing cuts friction by 20%, extends tool lifespan (94 points | 27 comments)
27. State Department Will Use AI to Search for 'Pro-Hamas' Students to Deport (41 points | 16 comments)
28. Compared to index funds, actively managed mutual funds still stink (31 points | 17 comments)
29. Kagi Is Bringing Orion Web Browser to Linux (299 points | 165 comments)
30. You might not need Redis (166 points | 111 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 9, 2025 at 5:10 AM UTC
